report.filters: sort-reverse=ROWID result_hosts_only=1 min_cvss_base= levels=hmlgd autofp=0 notes=0 overrides=0 first=1 rows=-1 delta_states=cgnshmlgd00001HighMediumLowLogDebug

nvt.name: DCE Services Enumeration
nvt.tags:
cvss_base_vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P|qod_type=remote_banner|solution=filter incoming traffic to this port.|summary=Distributed Computing Environment (DCE) services running on the remote host can be enumerated by connecting on port 135 and doing the appropriate queries.
An attacker may use this fact to gain more knowledge about the remote host.

nvt.name: DCE Services Enumeration
nvt.tags:
cvss_base_vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:P|qod_type=remote_banner|solution=filter incoming traffic to this port.|summary=Distributed Computing Environment (DCE) services running on the remote host can be enumerated by connecting on port 135 and doing the appropriate queries.
An attacker may use this fact to gain more knowledge about the remote host.

result.description:
Distributed Computing Environment (DCE) services running on the remote host can be enumerated by connecting on port 135 and doing the appropriate queries.
An attacker may use this fact to gain more knowledge about the remote host.
Here is the list of DCE services running on this host:
Port: 49152/tcp
UUID: d95afe70-a6d5-4259-822e-2c84da1ddb0d, version 1 Endpoint: ncacn_ip_tcp:218.32.1.71[49152]
Port: 49153/tcp
UUID: f6beaff7-1e19-4fbb-9f8f-b89e2018337c, version 1 Endpoint: ncacn_ip_tcp:218.32.1.71[49153] Annotation: Event log TCPIP
UUID: 30adc50c-5cbc-46ce-9a0e-91914789e23c, version 1 Endpoint: ncacn_ip_tcp:218.32.1.71[49153] Annotation: NRP server endpoint
UUID: 3c4728c5-f0ab-448b-bda1-6ce01eb0a6d6, version 1 Endpoint: ncacn_ip_tcp:218.32.1.71[49153] Annotation: DHCPv6 Client LRPC Endpoint
UUID: 3c4728c5-f0ab-448b-bda1-6ce01eb0a6d5, version 1 Endpoint: ncacn_ip_tcp:218.32.1.71[49153] Annotation: DHCP Client LRPC Endpoint
Port: 49154/tcp
UUID: 86d35949-83c9-4044-b424-db363231fd0c, version 1 Endpoint: ncacn_ip_tcp:218.32.1.71[49154]
UUID: a398e520-d59a-4bdd-aa7a-3c1e0303a511, version 1 Endpoint: ncacn_ip_tcp:218.32.1.71[49154] Annotation: IKE/Authip API
UUID: 552d076a-cb29-4e44-8b6a-d15e59e2c0af, version 1 Endpoint: ncacn_ip_tcp:218.32.1.71[49154] Annotation: IP Transition Configuration endpoint
UUID: 98716d03-89ac-44c7-bb8c-285824e51c4a, version 1 Endpoint: ncacn_ip_tcp:218.32.1.71[49154] Annotation: XactSrv service
UUID: c9ac6db5-82b7-4e55-ae8a-e464ed7b4277, version 1 Endpoint: ncacn_ip_tcp:218.32.1.71[49154] Annotation: Impl friendly name
UUID: 30b044a5-a225-43f0-b3a4-e060df91f9c1, version 1 Endpoint: ncacn_ip_tcp:218.32.1.71[49154]
Port: 49155/tcp
UUID: 12345778-1234-abcd-ef00-0123456789ac, version 1 Endpoint: ncacn_ip_tcp:218.32.1.71[49155] Named pipe : lsass Win32 service or process : lsass.exe Description : SAM access
Port: 49157/tcp
UUID: 367abb81-9844-35f1-ad32-98f038001003, version 2 Endpoint: ncacn_ip_tcp:218.32.1.71[49157]
Port: 49158/tcp
UUID: 6b5bdd1e-528c-422c-af8c-a4079be4fe48, version 1 Endpoint: ncacn_ip_tcp:218.32.1.71[49158] Annotation: Remote Fw APIs
UUID: 12345678-1234-abcd-ef00-0123456789ab, version 1 Endpoint: ncacn_ip_tcp:218.32.1.71[49158] Annotation: IPSec Policy agent endpoint Named pipe : spoolss Win32 service or process : spoolsv.exe Description : Spooler service
Solution : filter incoming traffic to this port(s).

nvt.name: Check for SSL Weak Ciphers
nvt.tags:
cvss_base_vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N|summary=This routine search for weak SSL ciphers offered by a service.|solution=The configuration of this services should be changed so that it does not support the listed weak ciphers anymore.|insight=These rules are applied for the evaluation of the cryptographic strength:
- Any SSL/TLS using no cipher is considered weak.
- All SSLv2 ciphers are considered weak due to a design flaw within the SSLv2 protocol.
- RC4 is considered to be weak (CVE-2013-2566).
- 64-bit block cipher 3DES vulnerable to SWEET32 attack (CVE-2016-2183).
- Ciphers using 64 bit or less are considered to be vulnerable to brute force methods and therefore considered as weak (CVE-2015-4000).
- 1024 bit RSA authentication is considered to be insecure and therefore as weak.
- CBC ciphers in TLS < 1.2 are considered to be vulnerable to the BEAST or Lucky 13 attacks
- Any cipher considered to be secure for only the next 10 years is considered as medium
- Any other cipher is considered as strong|qod_type=remote_app

result.description: Weak ciphers offered by this service: TLS1_0_RSA_WITH_RC4_128_MD5 TLS1_0_RSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA TLS1_0_RSA_WITH_3DES_EDE_CBC_SHA

nvt.name: Oracle MySQL Backronym Vulnerability June16 (Windows)
nvt.tags:
cvss_base_vector=AV:N/AC:M/Au:N/C:N/I:P/A:N|qod_type=remote_banner|summary=This host is running Oracle MySQL and is prone to the backronym vulnerability.|vuldetect=Get the installed version with the help of detect NVT and check the version is vulnerable or not.|insight=The flaw exist due to improper validation of MySQL client library when establishing a secure connection to a MySQL server using the --ssl option.|impact=Successful exploitation will allow man-in-the-middle attackers to spoof servers via a cleartext-downgrade attack.
Impact Level: Application|affected=Oracle MySQL Server 5.7.2 and earlier on Windows.|solution=Upgrade to version Oracle MySQL Server 5.7.3 or later. For updates refer to http://www.oracle.com|solution_type=VendorFix

result.description: Installed version: 5.1.67-community Fixed version: 5.7.3

nvt.name: Oracle MySQL Server Component 'Optimizer' Unspecified vulnerability Oct-2013 (Windows)
nvt.tags:
cvss_base_vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:S/C:N/I:N/A:P|summary=This host is running Oracle MySQL and is prone to unspecified vulnerability.|vuldetect=Get the installed version of MySQL with the help of detect NVT and check it is vulnerable or not.|solution=Apply the patch from below link, http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/topics/security/cpuoct2013-1899837.html|insight=Unspecified error in the MySQL Server component via unknown vectors related to Optimizer.|affected=Oracle MySQL versions 5.1.51 through 5.1.70, 5.5.10 through 5.5.32, and 5.6.x through 5.6.12 on Windows.|impact=Successful exploitation will allow remote attackers to disclose sensitive information, manipulate certain data, cause a DoS (Denial of Service) and bypass certain security restrictions.
Impact Level: Application|qod_type=remote_banner|solution_type=VendorFix

nvt.tags:

Impact Level: Application|affected=Oracle MySQL version 5.1.72 and earlier, 5.5.34 and earlier, and 5.6.14 and earlier on Windows.|solution=Apply the patch from below link, http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/topics/security/cpujan2014-1972949.html|qod_type=remote_banner|solution_type=VendorFix

nvt.name: SSL Certificate Signed Using A Weak Signature Algorithm
nvt.tags: cvss_base_vector=AV:N/AC:H/Au:N/C:P/I:P/A:N|qod_type=remote_banner|insight=Secure Hash Algorithm 1 (SHA-1) is considered cryptographically weak and not secure enough for ongoing use. Beginning as late as January 2017 and as early as June 2016, browser developers such as Microsoft and Google will begin warning users when users visit web sites that use SHA-1 signed Secure Socket Layer (SSL) certificates. Servers that use SSL certificates signed using an SHA-1 signature will need to obtain new SHA-2 signed SSL certificates to avoid these web browser SSL certificate warnings.|vuldetect=Check which algorithm was used to sign the remote SSL Certificate.|summary=The remote service is using a SSL certificate chain that has been signed using a cryptographically weak hashing algorithm.

result.description:
The following certificates are part of the certificate chain but using insecure signature algorithms:
Subject: CN=WIN-9NAUTP0UL3T Signature Algorithm: sha1WithRSAEncryption

nvt.name: TCP timestamps
nvt.tags:
cvss_base_vector=AV:N/AC:H/Au:N/C:P/I:N/A:N|summary=The remote host implements TCP timestamps and therefore allows to compute the uptime.|vuldetect=Special IP packets are forged and sent with a little delay in between to the target IP. The responses are searched for a timestamps. If found, the timestamps are reported.|solution=To disable TCP timestamps on linux add the line 'net.ipv4.tcp_timestamps = 0' to /etc/sysctl.conf. Execute 'sysctl -p' to apply the settings at runtime.
To disable TCP timestamps on Windows execute 'netsh int tcp set global timestamps=disabled'
Starting with Windows Server 2008 and Vista, the timestamp can not be completely disabled.
The default behavior of the TCP/IP stack on this Systems is, to not use the Timestamp options when initiating TCP connections, but use them if the TCP peer that is initiating communication includes them in their synchronize (SYN) segment.
See also: http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=9152|affected=TCP/IPv4 implementations that implement RFC1323.|insight=The remote host implements TCP timestamps, as defined by RFC1323.|impact=A side effect of this feature is that the uptime of the remote host can sometimes be computed.|qod_type=remote_banner

result.description:
It was detected that the host implements RFC1323.
The following timestamps were retrieved with a delay of 1 seconds in-between: Paket 1: 1819040088 Paket 2: 1819040194

nvt.name: CPE Inventory
nvt.tags: cvss_base_vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:N|qod_type=remote_banner|summary=This routine uses information collected by other routines about CPE identities (http://cpe.mitre.org/) of operating systems, services and applications detected during the scan.

result.description: 218.32.1.71|cpe:/a:oracle:mysql:5.1.67-community 218.32.1.71|cpe:/o:microsoft:windows

nvt.name: SMB Test
nvt.tags: cvss_base_vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:N|qod_type=executable_version|summary=Test remote host SMB Functions

result.description: The tool "smbclient" is not available for OpenVAS. Therefore none of the tests using smbclient are executed.

nvt.name: ICMP Timestamp Detection
nvt.tags: cvss_base_vector=AV:L/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:N|qod_type=remote_banner|summary=The remote host responded to an ICMP timestamp request. The Timestamp Reply is an ICMP message which replies to a Timestamp message. It consists of the originating timestamp sent by the sender of the Timestamp as well as a receive timestamp and a transmit timestamp. This information could theoretically be used to exploit weak time-based random number generators in other services.

nvt.name: OS Detection Consolidation
nvt.tags: cvss_base_vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:N|summary=This script consolidates the OS information detected by several NVTs and tries to find the best matching OS.|qod_type=remote_active

result.description:
Best matching OS: cpe:/o:microsoft:windows Found by NVT 1.3.6.1.4.1.25623.1.0.102011 (SMB NativeLanMan)
Other OS detections (in order of reliability): OS: cpe:/o:microsoft:windows found by NVT 1.3.6.1.4.1.25623.1.0.102002 (ICMP based OS Fingerprinting)

nvt.name: Traceroute
nvt.tags: cvss_base_vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:N|solution=Block unwanted packets from escaping your network.|summary=A traceroute from the scanning server to the target system was conducted. This traceroute is provided primarily for informational value only. In the vast majority of cases, it does not represent a vulnerability. However, if the displayed traceroute contains any private addresses that should not have been publicly visible, then you have an issue you need to correct.|qod_type=remote_banner

nvt.tags: cvss_base_vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:N|summary=This script detects wether port 445 and 139 are open and if they are running a CIFS/SMB server.|qod_type=remote_banner

result.description: A SMB server is running on this port

nvt.name: SMB NativeLanMan
nvt.tags: cvss_base_vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:N|summary=It is possible to extract OS, domain and SMB server information from the Session Setup AndX Response packet which is generated during NTLM authentication.|qod_type=remote_active

result.description: Detected SMB workgroup: WORKGROUP Detected SMB server: Windows Server 2008 R2 Enterprise 6.1 Detected OS: Windows Server 2008 R2 Enterprise 7601 Service Pack 1

5.1.67-community-log > (j^ydjiN ÿ÷! -3X@yb^2z2*z

nvt.name: Services
nvt.tags: cvss_base_vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:N|qod_type=remote_banner|summary=This routine attempts to guess which service is running on the remote ports. For instance, it searches for a web server which could listen on another port than 80 or 443 and makes this information available for other check routines.

result.description: An unknown service is running on this port. It is usually reserved for MySQL

nvt.name: Database Open Access Vulnerability
nvt.tags:
cvss_base_vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:N|impact=Successful exploitation could allow an attacker to obtain the sensitive information of the database.
Impact Level: Application|insight=Do not restricting direct access of databases to the remote systems.|summary=The host is running a Database server and is prone to information disclosure vulnerability.|affected=MySQL IBM DB2 PostgreSQL IBM solidDB Oracle Database Microsoft SQL Server|solution=Restrict Database access to remote systems.|solution_type=Workaround|qod_type=remote_banner

result.description: MySQL can be accessed by remote attackers

nvt.name: MySQL/MariaDB Detection
nvt.tags:
cvss_base_vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:N|summary=Detection of installed version of MySQL/MariaDB.
Detect a running MySQL/MariaDB by getting the banner, Extract the version from the banner and store the information in KB|qod_type=remote_banner

result.description:
Detected MySQL Version: 5.1.67-community-log Location: 3307/tcp CPE: cpe:/a:oracle:mysql:5.1.67-community
Concluded from version identification result:
5.1.67-community-log G D>H/R1>! ÿ÷! *O1C?PU=n3Py

nvt.name: Database Open Access Vulnerability
nvt.tags:
cvss_base_vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:N|impact=Successful exploitation could allow an attacker to obtain the sensitive information of the database.
Impact Level: Application|insight=Do not restricting direct access of databases to the remote systems.|summary=The host is running a Database server and is prone to information disclosure vulnerability.|affected=MySQL IBM DB2 PostgreSQL IBM solidDB Oracle Database Microsoft SQL Server|solution=Restrict Database access to remote systems.|solution_type=Workaround|qod_type=remote_banner

result.description: MySQL can be accessed by remote attackers

nvt.name: SSL Certificate - Self-Signed Certificate Detection

nvt.name: Services
nvt.tags: cvss_base_vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:N|qod_type=remote_banner|summary=This routine attempts to guess which service is running on the remote ports. For instance, it searches for a web server which could listen on another port than 80 or 443 and makes this information available for other check routines.

result.description: A TLScustom server answered on this port

nvt.name: Identify unknown services with nmap
nvt.tags:
cvss_base_vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:N|qod_type=remote_banner|summary=This plugin performs service detection by launching nmap's service probe against ports running unidentified services.
Description :
This plugin is a complement of find_service.nasl. It launches nmap -sV (probe requests) against ports that are running unidentified services.

result.description: Nmap service detection result for this port: ms-wbt-server This is a guess. A confident identification of the service was not possible.

nvt.name: Check for SSL Ciphers
nvt.tags: cvss_base_vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:N|summary=This routine search for SSL ciphers offered by a service.|qod_type=remote_app

result.description:
Service supports TLSv1 ciphers.
Medium ciphers offered by this service: TLS1_0_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA TLS1_0_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA TLS1_0_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA TLS1_0_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
Weak ciphers offered by this service: TLS1_0_RSA_WITH_RC4_128_MD5 TLS1_0_RSA_WITH_RC4_128_SHA TLS1_0_RSA_WITH_3DES_EDE_CBC_SHA
No non-ciphers are supported by this service

nvt.name: Check for SSL Medium Ciphers
nvt.tags: cvss_base_vector=AV:N/AC:L/Au:N/C:N/I:N/A:N|summary=This Plugin reports about SSL Medium Ciphers.|qod_type=remote_app

result.description: Medium ciphers offered by this service: TLS1_0_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA TLS1_0_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA TLS1_0_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA TLS1_0_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA
